body_html:
Hello. I tried building and installing again following the instructions on the tensorflow website for building from source and I'm getting the same error.

First I cloned the repo
git clone https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow

Then I configured it using
./configure
I selected
/usr/bin/python3
and its respective default dist-packages location. For the other options, I said yes to using jemalloc and then no to all the others. I left the -march=native part as default.

I then built using:
bazel build --config=opt --local_resources 512,.5,1.0 //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package

Then, I built the pip package using
bazel-bin/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/build_pip_package /tmp/tensorflow_pkg

Then, I installed the pip package via:
sudo pip3 install /tmp/tensorflow_pkg/tensorflow-1.7.0rc1-cp35-cp35m-linux_armv7l.whl

Afterwards, when I opened the python terminal in a separate directory and tried to import tensorflow, I got the same error.
body_text:
Hello. I tried building and installing again following the instructions on the tensorflow website for building from source and I'm getting the same error.
First I cloned the repo
git clone https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow 
Then I configured it using
./configure
I selected
/usr/bin/python3
and its respective default dist-packages location. For the other options, I said yes to using jemalloc and then no to all the others. I left the -march=native part as default.
I then built using:
bazel build --config=opt --local_resources 512,.5,1.0 //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package
Then, I built the pip package using
bazel-bin/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/build_pip_package /tmp/tensorflow_pkg
Then, I installed the pip package via:
sudo pip3 install /tmp/tensorflow_pkg/tensorflow-1.7.0rc1-cp35-cp35m-linux_armv7l.whl
Afterwards, when I opened the python terminal in a separate directory and tried to import tensorflow, I got the same error.
body:
Hello. I tried building and installing again following the instructions on the tensorflow website for building from source and I'm getting the same error.

First I cloned the repo
`git clone https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow `

Then I configured it using
`./configure`
I selected
`/usr/bin/python3`
and its respective default dist-packages location. For the other options, I said yes to using jemalloc and then no to all the others. I left the -march=native part as default.

I then built using:
`bazel build --config=opt --local_resources 512,.5,1.0 //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package`

Then, I built the pip package using
`bazel-bin/tensorflow/tools/pip_package/build_pip_package /tmp/tensorflow_pkg`

Then, I installed the pip package via:
`sudo pip3 install /tmp/tensorflow_pkg/tensorflow-1.7.0rc1-cp35-cp35m-linux_armv7l.whl`

Afterwards, when I opened the python terminal in a separate directory and tried to import tensorflow, I got the same error.
